_id.description: A system-generated unique identifier for a historical placement, with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

organisation_name.description:
Name of the organisation the user belongs to. 
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

company_name.description:
The company name of the user belongs to.
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

user.description:
The user information who is performing some action within a certain context. 

This is normally either a broker OR an underwriter.

underwriter_pool.description:
This allows the broker to attach a pre-defined list of underwriters to a placement instead of scrolling through the entire list of underwriters on the platform.

---

LDM Ref: Underwriter Pool

_xid.description: Id of the company UW belongs to

name.description: Name of the company UW belongs to

placement_read_access.description: Teams/Users that have access to the placement document, as a result of being an owner of one or more entities within the placement structure.

client_name.description:
The name by which the broker knows the insured.
 
For example "BA" for British Airways.

LDM Ref: Placement.Placement Client Name

description.description:
A description of the placement supplied by the broker.


LDM Ref: Placement.Placement Description

effective_year.description:
The year in which the placement is effective.
 
For example "2020".

LDM Ref: Placement.Effective Year

programmes.description:
A collection of contracts for a common purpose.
 
For example a programme for an airline will have individual contracts for staff, cargo, aircraft etc.

LDM Ref: Programme

default.description: Field indicating whether this is a default programme, e.g. there are no programme details, it is an empty container.

broker_team.description: Broker team array is for keeping the  IDs of the broker team responsible for the placement.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

organisation_name.description:
Name of the organisation the user belongs to. 
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

company_name.description:
The company name of the user belongs to.
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

user.description:
The user information who is performing some action within a certain context. 

This is normally either a broker OR an underwriter.

description.description:
A description of the programme supplied by the broker.
 
For example "British Airways' 2020 programme for staff, cargo, aircraft etc.".

LDM Ref: Programme.Programme Description

inception_date.description:
The earliest inception date of any contract contained within the programme structure.
 
For example 2020-01-01.

LDM Ref: Programme.Programme Inception Date

status_code.description:
The code that represents the overall programme status.

LDM Ref: Programme.Programme Status Code

sequence_number.description:
The sequence number in which the programme should be displayed in the UI.

LDM Ref: Programme.Programme Sequence Number

documents.description:
Details on document attachments.
 
For example a Market Reform Contract.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Programme ID

_xid.description: _id of the Document to which we are referencing.

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Document File Name

contracts.description: A document created by a broker that contains a summary of the terms of a proposed (re)insurance contract which is then presented by the broker to selected underwriters for their consideration. Underwriters may delete, amend or add terms on a contract as they consider appropriate for the purpose of providing an indication or a quotation. After a quotation has been accepted the contract is revised and includes the underwriters’ stamps, signed lines and references, and is used to process premiums.

broker_team.description: Broker team array is for keeping the  IDs of the broker team responsible for the contract.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

organisation_name.description:
Name of the organisation the user belongs to. 
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

company_name.description:
The company name of the user belongs to.
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

user.description:
The user information who is performing some action within a certain context. 

This is normally either a broker OR an underwriter.

broker_code.description:
A 4-digit code that represents a broker organisation. A broker can have multiple codes either as a result of historic M&A activity, or where each one is used to write specific classes of business.

LDM Ref: Broker Code

broker_contract_ref.description:
The reference allocated by the broker to identify the contract.
  
For example "B0999ABC123456789v1".

LDM Ref: Contract.Broker Contract Reference

contract_umr.description: UMR of the contract. It should always be "B" + "broker_code" + "broker_contract_ref".

sequence_number.description:
The sequence number that defines the order in which the contracts should be displayed in the UI.

LDM Ref: Contract.Contract Sequence Number

description.description:
A description of the contract supplied by the broker.
 
For example "Aircraft Liability and Hull Insurance".


LDM Ref: Contract.Contract Description
examples: This contract pertains to single participant aviation cover

contract_type.description:
The code that represents the contract type in the ACORD A82 standard.
  
For example direct_insurance_contract, reinsurance_contract, retrocession_contract.

LDM Ref: Contract. Contract Type Code

cover_type.description:
The code that represents the cover type in the ACORD A31 standard.
  
For example excess_of_loss, facultative_proportional, proportional_treaty etc.

LDM Ref: Contract.Cover Type code

status.description:
The code that represents the contract status. This will change throughout the life of a contract.

LDM Ref:  Contract.Contract Status Code

sub_status.description: Calculated field used by OutSystems, it depends on participation status

insureds.description:
A person who is insured under a contract of insurance. Where there is one Insured this person may also be referred to as the policyholder. This can be an insured, assured, reinsured or retrocessionaire.
  
For example MSC may be insured for marine policies.

LDM Ref: Insured

items.description:
A person who is insured under a contract of insurance. Where there is one Insured this person may also be referred to as the policyholder. This can be an insured, assured, reinsured or retrocessionaire.

---

LDM Ref: Insured

name.description:
The name of the insured party or original policyholder.

---

LDM Ref: Insured.Insured Name

role.description:
The type of role that a particular party can play.

---

LDM Ref: Party Role Type

documents.description:
Details on document attachments.
 
For example a Market Reform Contract.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Programme ID

_xid.description: _id of the Document to which we are referencing.

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Document File Name

sections.description:
A section of the contract representing a specific partition of the overall risk to be insured. A contract section can be based upon the contract type (e.g. insurance/reinsurance), coverage (e.g. class of business) and/or layer (limit of liability).
The recursive relationship captures the relationship between a section and its sub-sections.

LDM Ref: Section

default.description: Field indicating whether this is a default section, e.g. there are no section details, it is an empty container.

geographic_coverage.description:
A mapping between Section and Geographic Unit. This allows a section to cover multiple geographic units, and list each one separately.

LDM Ref: Geographic Coverage

geographic_coverage_description.description:
A high level description of the situation, territorial limits or scope, trading warranties or location.
  
For example "Offices of the insured in the UK, Spain, New Zealand and Austria".

LDM Entity:
Section.Geographic Coverage Description/Situation Description  (LDM to update) 

In "Theme 4 Data Matrix v10.1.xlsx", this field is referred to as "Section.Situation Description"

reference.description:
The reference used to identify the section.
 
For example I, II etc.

LDM Ref: Section.Reference

description.description:
A description of the section.
  
For example "All Risks of Physical Damage (including Machinery Breakdown and Boiler Explosion)".

LDM Ref: Section.Description

sequence_number.description:
The sequence number that defines the order in which the sections should be displayed in the UI.

LDM Ref: Section.Section Sequence Number

status.description:
The code that represents the section status.

LDM: Section.Section Status Code

product_code.description:
The 3-digit code that represents the product in the ACORD A34 standard.
  
For example 001 for agriculture and forestry, 058 for livestock etc.

LDM Ref: Section.Product Code

inception_date.description:
The date on which the (re)insurance contract comes into force.
 
For example 2020-01-01.

LDM Ref: Section.Inception Date

expiry_date.description:
The date on which the (re)insurance contract ceases cover.
 
For example 2020-12-31.

LDM Ref: Section.Expiry Date

period_duration_number.description:
The quantity of the policy duration period.
 
For example 30, 4, 12, 1.

LDM Ref: Section.Period Duration Number

duration_unit_type_code.description:
The code that represents the duration unit type.

LDM Ref: Section.Duration Unit Type Code

period_qualifier_type_code.description:
The code that represents the period qualifier type.

LDM Ref: Section.Period Qualifier Type Code

period_description.description:
A description of the specific events determining the period for risks where specific dates of inception or expiry are not known.
 
For example voyages, constructions and sporting events.


LDM Ref: Section.Period Description

order_percentage.description:
The amount of the sum insured that is covered by the contract or section. A blank Order Hereon can be valid at the time of placing (i.e. when the client has not informed the broker of the order, or the broker has been asked to place “as much as possible” by the client). However there is a requirement to reflect the final order on the contract when it is determined.
 
For example "80%".

LDM Ref: Section.Order Percentage

line_of_business.description:
The code that represents the ACORD line of business. This is not included in the ACORD A34 standard, so is defined by PPL.


LDM Ref: Product.Line of Business

settlement_due_date.description:
The date and time by which the insurers wish to receive their premium.
 
For example 2020-06-01 12:00:00.


LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Settlement Due Datetime

installment_period_of_credit.description:
The number of days added to the client due dates of subsequent installments.

LDM Ref:  Settlement Information.Installment Credit Period Days

adjustment_period_of_credit.description:
The number of days after the date(s) specified for the provision of adjustments that insurers expect the final adjustment(s) of premium (if any) to be paid.

LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Adjustment Credit Period Days

stamp_permission_type.description:
The code that represents the permitted territory type.


LDM Ref: Section.Stamp Permission Type Code

risks.description:
A mapping between Section and Risk Code. This allows a section to cover multiple risk codes.

LDM Ref: Section Risk Classification

risk_code.description:
The 1 or 2 character risk code.
  
For example 1E, M2, W etc.

LDM Ref: Section Risk Classification.Risk Code

currency_code.description:
The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.
  
For example "GBP".

LDM Ref: Section Risk Classification.Currency Code

amount.description:
The amount of premium that is deemed to be the cost of covering a particular risk code. Depending on how the contract is written either the premium percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both.
 
For example £1,000 is allocated to risk code 6T.


LDM Ref: Section Risk Classification.Premium Amount

rate.description:
The percentage of the total premium that is deemed to be the cost of covering a particular risk code. Depending on how the contract is written either the premium percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both.
 
For example 50% of the premium is allocated to risk code 6T.

LDM Ref: Section Risk Classification.Premium Percentage

limits.description:
Details on the limits of liability and deductibles that the insured must pay prior to the payment of a claim. These can occur either overall or with reference to a particular section.


LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible

type_ref.description:
The code that represents the limit type.

---

Reference Data: LimitType

LDM Ref: Limit. Limit Type Code

type.description:
This field is a free-text that represents the limit type description. 

It is only field when limit type code is 'other'.

---

LDM Ref: Limit.Basis Type Description

currency_code.description:
The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.
For example "GBP".


LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible. currency code

amount.description:
The limit or deductible amount payed by the insurer or (re)insured respectively. Depending on how the contract is written either the limit/deductible percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both.
  
For example 1,000.

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Amount

basis_refs.description:
The code that represents the limit basis type. 

UPDATE: Regarding integration with Artificial, a section can now have more than one Limit Basis selected, except when the limit basis dropdown was selected to 'Other'.

---

Reference Data: LimitBasisType

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Type Code

basis_type_code.description:
A description of the limit basis, captured when there is a no alignment to the reference data codes. It can only be filled when limit basis code is 'other'.

---

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Description

specification.description: A description providing an additional narrative and context to the Limit.

attachment_point.description: A collection of attributes that define the attachment point to any claim relating to the contract.

currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

amount.description: The amount of deductible or excess applicable to any claim relating to the contract.

percentage.description: The excess as a percentage of the sum insured or limit applicable to any claim relating to the contract.

basis_type_codes.description:
A list of codes that represent the basis of the Attachment Point.

---

LDM ref: TBD

basis_description.description: A bespoke description of the limit basis type, where not provisioned under the existing reference data basis type codes.

specification.description: A description providing an additional narrative and context to the Attachment Point.

type.description:
The code that represents the excess type.

---

Reference Data: ExcessType

percentage.description: Percentage of an excess. Added as part of ART047C scope.

basis_refs.description:
The code that represents the excess basis type. 

UPDATE: Regarding integration with Artificial, a section can now have more than one Excess Basis selected, except when the limit basis dropdown was selected to 'Other'.

---

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Type Code

basis_type_code.description:
A description of the excess basis, captured when there is a no alignment to the reference data codes. It can only be filled when excess basis code is 'other'.

---

LDM Entity: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Description applicable to Excesses based on Data Matrix 1.18

specification.description: A description providing an additional narrative and context to the excess.

deductibles.description:
Details on deductibles that the insured must pay prior to the payment of a claim. These can occur either overall or with reference to a particular section.

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductibles

type_ref.description:
The code that represents the deductible type.

---

ReferenceData: DeductibleType

type.description:
This field is a free-text that represents the deductible type description. 

It is only popullated when deductible type code is 'other'.

---

currency_code.description:
The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.
  
For example "GBP".


LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Currency Code

amount.description:
The limit or deductible amount payed by the insurer or (re)insured respectively. Depending on how the contract is written either the limit/deductible percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both.
  
For example 1,000.


LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Amount

percentage.description: Percentage of a deductible. Added as part of ART047C scope.

basis_refs.description:
The code that represents the deductible basis type. 

UPDATE: Regarding integration with Artificial, a section can now have more than one Deductible Basis selected, except when the limit basis dropdown was selected to 'Other'.

---

Reference Data: DeductibleBasisType

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Type Code

basis_type_code.description:
A description of the deductible basis, captured when there is a no alignment to the reference data codes. It can only be filled when deductible basis code is 'Other'.

---

LDM Ref: Limit/Deductible.Limit/Deductible Basis Description

specification.description: A description providing an additional narrative and context to the deductible.

premiums.description:
The amount charged to provide coverage described in the policy.

LDM Ref: Premium

type_ref.description:
The code that represents the premium type.

---

Reference Data: PremiumType

LDM Ref: Premium. Premium Type Code

type.description:
This field is a free-text that represents the limit type description. 

It is only popullated when limit type code is 'other'.

---

LDM Ref: Premiums.Basis Type Description

currency_code.description:
The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.
  
For example "GBP".

LDM Ref: Premium.Currency Code

amount.description:
The premium amount to be paid by the (re)insured. Depending on how the contract is written either the premium percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both. The value can change as the placement develops, but both document and data will be kept in sync.
 
For example 1,000.


LDM Ref: Premium.Premium Amount

rate.description:
The premium rate to be paid by the (re)insured as defined by the Premium Basis attribute. Depending on how the contract is written either the premium percentage or amount field will be populated, but not both.
 
For example 5%.

LDM Ref: Premium.Premium Rate

rate_unit_code.description:
The code that represents the premium rate unit.
For example percentage, pro_mille.

Reference Data: PremiumRateUnit

LDM Ref: Premium.Premium Rate Unit Code

basis_refs.description:
The code that represents the premium basis type. 

UPDATE: Regarding integration with Artificial, a section can now have more than one Limit Basis selected, except when the limit basis dropdown was selected to 'Other'.

Reference Data: PremiumBasisType

LDM Ref: Premium.Premium Basis Type Code

basis_type_code.description:
A description of the premium basis, captured when there is a no alignment to the reference data codes. 

It can only be filled when premium basis code is 'other'.

---

LDM Ref: Premium.Premium Basis Type Code

basis_percentage.description: The percentage that represents the basis percentage applied to the premium.

adjustment_type_code.description:
The code that represents the type of adjustment applied to a premium.

---

LDM ref: TBD

rate.description: The adjustment rate applicable under the terms of the insurance Contract or Section.

rate_unit.description:
The code that represents the unit of measurement to be applied to supplied rate.

---

LDM ref: TBD

basis_type_codes.description:
The list of codes that represents the basis of the premium adjustment rate.

---

LDM ref: TBD

basis_description.description: A bespoke description of the premium basis type, where not provisioned under the existing reference data basis type codes.

adjustment_rate.description: A collection of attributes in reference to the premium adjustment rate applicable.

discount_applied_indicator.description:
Indicates whether a discount has been applied (Y) to a Premium or not (N).

NOTE: As part of ART047A, this field was changed from a boolean into a string due to a OutSystems limitation: it does not differ between not filling the field and filling as false. For this field, we want 3 possible states:

 - Yes: field populated as "Y"
 - No: field populated as "N"
 - Not defined: field does not exist

period_type_code.description:
The code that represents the period that the premium amount covers.

---

LDM ref: TBD

binding_information.description:
Binding information specific to the section.

LDM Ref: Binding Information

written_line_type.description:
The code that represents the written line type.

LDM Ref: Binding Information.Written Line Type Code

currency_code.description:
The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.
  
For example "GBP".

---

LDM Ref: Premium.Currency Code

written_line_basis.description:
The basis on which the underwriter's written lines are applied to the order or contract.
  
For example percentage of whole, percentage of order, part of whole, part of order.


LDM Ref: Binding Information.Written Line Basis

signed_line_basis.description:
The basis on which the underwriter's signed lines are applied to the order or contract.
 
For example percentage of whole, percentage of order, part of whole, part of order.


LDM Ref: Binding Information.Signed Line Basis

signed_down_decimal_places.description:
The number of decimals used by the broker in their signing down calculations.


LDM Ref: Binding Information.Signed Down Decimal Places

signed_down_order_percentage.description:
The order percentage used by the broker in their signing down calculations.
 
For example "80%".


LDM Ref: Binding Information.Signed Down Order Percentage

documents.description:
Details on document attachments.
 
For example a Market Reform Contract.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Programme ID

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

period_qualifier_description.description:
A description of the period qualifier, captured when there is a no alignment to the reference data codes.

LDM Ref: Section.Period Qualifier Description

unresolved_fo.description: Calculated field used by OutSystems, it depends on FirmOrder

conveyance_description.description:
A description of the interest or subject matter insured or nature of liability.

Note: Based on XPR540 and  "Theme 4 Data Matrix v10.1.xlsx", this field has been moved from Contract to Section. 

LDM Entity Ref:
Section.Conveyance Description (LDM yet to be updated)

interest_description.description:
A description of the interest or subject matter insured or nature of liability.
 
For example
"Real and Personal Property at the offices of the insured in the UK, Austria New Zealand and Spain, including the additional coverages defined below:
 
Personal Property of the Insured’s Officials and Employees while on the Premises of the Insured
Improvements and Betterments
Business Interruption (Net Profits and / or Fixed Charges)
Ordinary Payroll
Rental Value / Rental Income
Electronic Data Processing Equipment and Machinery
 
and as fully defined in the contract wording and clauses referenced herein."

Note: Based on XPR540 and  "Theme 4 Data Matrix v10.1.xlsx", this field has been moved from Contract to Section. 

LDM:
Section.Interest Description (LDM yet to be updated)

classification_type.description:
The code that represents the classification type in the ACORD A82 standard.
  
For example direct_insurance_contract, reinsurance_contract, retrocession_contract.

NOTE: This field was added at section level as part of ART047B scope.

---

Reference data: ContractType

LDM Ref: Contract. Contract Type Code

cover_type.description:
The code that represents the cover type in the ACORD A31 standard.
  
For example excess_of_loss, facultative_proportional, proportional_treaty etc.

LDM Ref: Contract.Cover Type code

insureds.description:
A person who is insured under a contract of insurance. Where there is one Insured this person may also be referred to as the policyholder. This can be an insured, assured, reinsured or retrocessionaire.
  
For example MSC may be insured for marine policies.

NOTE: This array was added at section level as part of ART047B scope.

A person who is insured under a contract of insurance. Where there is one Insured this person may also be referred to as the policyholder. This can be an insured, assured, reinsured or retrocessionaire.

The type of role that a particular party can play.

facility_usage.description: This field will store the the sections_id of master facility if master facility is used as participations for this declaration. There can be multiple master facility used for a single section.

items.description: master facility section id used as part of this placement section.

status_flags.description:
Array that stores all the Section Status codes a section can have simultaneously.

LDM: Section.Section Status Code

Reference Data: SectionStatus

backload_indicator.description: Indicates that the contract has been backloaded when True.

backload_reason_code.description: The code that represents the backload reason.

backload_description.description: A note containing details associated with the backload.

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

unresolved_fo.description: Calculated field used by OutSystems, it depends on FirmOrder

based_on_version.description:
a contract version can be created based on a existing version. 
This field will store the base version.

facility_published.description:
For facilities only.

Denotes if a facility contract is published or not.

first_sign_and_close_date.description: The datetime where this contract was first sign and close status.

read_access.description:
Team ID that need the read access of the contract.

Note:
Currently this field will be populated to give the access of the declaration contract to master facility owning team. In future this field can be used to give the 'read only' access to team other than owning team of the contract.

facility_access.description: Teams/Users that have read/see the current facility contract and potentially use it in a declaration.

status_flags.description:
Array that stores all the Contract Status codes a contract can have simultaneously.

Reference data: ContractStatus

LDM Ref:  Contract.Contract Status Code

umr_released.description: set to true when the UMR release changes takes place

renewed_from.description:
This object field contains information regarding the original contract from which this contract was renewed.

The absence of this object field means that the contract was not renewed from another existing contract.

---

NOTE: This object field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

contract.description:
ID of the original contract.

---

NOTE: This field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

placement.description:
ID of the original placement.

---

NOTE: This field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

renewed_to.description:
This object field contains information regarding the renewal contract from which this contract has been renewed.

The absence of this object field means that the contract was not renewed.

---

NOTE: This object field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

contract.description:
ID of the renewal contract.

---

NOTE: This field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

placement.description:
ID of the renewal placement.

---

NOTE: This field was added to the placements collection as part of the REX02 User Story.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

inception_date.description:
This is going to be a calculated field based on the contracts within the Placement and It's been decided it’s best to re-calculate this field every time a new contract is added or updated instead of every time we retrieve a placement.

LDM Ref: Placement

The code that represents the overall placement status.

Details on document attachments.

defines the type of placement. facility OR Non-Facility.
